items.name: Maximum number of opened files

items.name: Maximum number of processes

items.description: Number of processes in running state.
items.name: Number of running processes

items.description: Total number of processes in any state.
items.name: Number of processes

items.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.
items.name: Processor load (1 min average per core)

items.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.
items.name: Processor load (5 min average per core)

items.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.
items.name: Processor load (15 min average per core)

items.description: The time spent running a virtual CPU for guest operating systems
items.name: CPU guest time

items.description: The time spent running a niced guest (virtual CPU for guest operating systems)
items.name: CPU guest nice time

items.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.
items.name: CPU idle time

items.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.
items.name: CPU interrupt time

items.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.
items.name: CPU iowait time

items.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.
items.name: CPU nice time

items.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.
items.name: CPU softirq time

items.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).
items.name: CPU steal time

items.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.
items.name: CPU system time

items.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.
items.name: CPU user time

items.name: Host name

items.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.
items.name: System information

items.name: Number of logged in users

trigger_prototypes.name: Free disk space is less than 20% on volume {#FSNAME}
Free inodes is less than 20% on volume {#FSNAME}

triggers.name: Configured max number of opened files is too low on {HOST.NAME}
Configured max number of processes is too low on {HOST.NAME}

triggers.description: OS spends significant time waiting for I/O (input/output) operations. It could be indicator of performance issues with storage system.
triggers.name: Disk I/O is overloaded on {HOST.NAME}
Lack of available memory on server {HOST.NAME}

triggers.description: It probably means that the systems requires more physical memory.
triggers.name: Lack of free swap space on {HOST.NAME}
Processor load is too high on {HOST.NAME}
